speaker: Fool
text_entry: SCENE III. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER and EDMUND

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, alack, Edmund, I like not this unnatural

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: dealing. When I desire their leave that I might

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: pity him, they took from me the use of mine own

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: house; charged me, on pain of their perpetual

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: displeasure, neither to speak of him, entreat for

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: him, nor any way sustain him.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Most savage and unnatural!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Go to; say you nothing. There's a division betwixt

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the dukes; and a worse matter than that: I have

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: received a letter this night; 'tis dangerous to be

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: spoken; I have locked the letter in my closet:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: these injuries the king now bears will be revenged

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: home; there's part of a power already footed: we

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: must incline to the king. I will seek him, and

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: privily relieve him: go you and maintain talk with

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the duke, that my charity be not of him perceived:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if he ask for me. I am ill, and gone to bed.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Though I die for it, as no less is threatened me,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the king my old master must be relieved. There is

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: some strange thing toward, Edmund; pray you, be careful.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This courtesy, forbid thee, shall the duke

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Instantly know; and of that letter too:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This seems a fair deserving, and must draw me

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That which my father loses; no less than all:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The younger rises when the old doth fall.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit
